text:
Kanhaiya Kumar was greeted with loud cheers by his supporters when he came out of prison.

JNU Students Union president Kanhaiya Kumar, who was granted interim bail for six months in a sedition case by the Delhi High Court on Wednesday, was released from the Tihar jail on Thursday amid celebrations by his supporters.

“Mr. Kanhaiya was released from the jail at around 6.30 pm after his bail bond and release orders were properly scrutinised,” Additional IG (Prisons) and Tihar spokesperson Mukesh Prasad said.

He was arrested on February 12 in connection with an event on JNU campus on to protest the hanging of Parliament attack convict Afzal Guru during which anti-national slogans were allegedly raised.

The student leader was greeted with loud cheers by his supporters when he came out of Tihar Jail. Celebrations also erupted on the JNU campus. Earlier in the day, a city court issued Kanhaiya’s release order after he furnished a bail bond. Jail officials said the papers for the release. — PTI
title: Kanhaiya released from Tihar jail
